dojo.title: Git Dojo
dojo.subtitle: Select today's challenge
dojo.terminalInstruction: Enter commands in the terminal below
dojo.giveUpConfirm: Are you sure you want to give up?
dojo.backConfirm: Are you sure? Your progress won't be saved.

confirmExit.title: Exit Challenge?
confirmExit.message: Your progress will not be saved. Are you sure you want to exit?

generic.1: Use git status to check the current state
generic.3: Use git help <command> to learn about commands

101.title: Your First Commit
101.description: A README file has been created. Stage and commit this file.
101.trivia: git add . stages all changes in the current directory. To stage specific files, specify the filename.

102.title: Create a Branch
102.description: To develop a new feature, create a new branch and switch to it.
102.trivia: Use git switch -c <branch-name> to create and switch to a branch in one command.

103.title: Resolve Merge Conflict
103.description: Alice and Bob edited the same file simultaneously. Resolve the merge conflict and create a commit that includes both changes.
103.trivia: Conflict markers are <<<<<<< HEAD, =======, and >>>>>>>. Above ======= is your current branch, below is the branch being merged.

201.title: Rebase Basics
201.description: Rebase the feature branch onto the latest commit of the main branch.
201.trivia: Rebasing keeps commit history linear, but rebasing already-pushed branches can cause issues.

emptyRepo.title: Repository is empty
emptyRepo.description: Push your first commit to see the graph.

workspace.title: REPOSITORIES
workspace.deleteConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete project <1>{{name}}</1>? This action cannot be undone.
workspace.noFiles: No files found. The directory is empty.
workspace.createHint: Create a folder with mkdir or git clone something.

validation.invalidUrl: URL must start with https:// or git@

compare.title: New Pull Request
compare.desc: Select branches to compare and merge changes.
compare.ableToMergeDesc: No conflicts. These branches can be merged automatically.

list.deleteConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete this PR?
list.deletePRConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete this pull request?

status.invalidRepo: Invalid repository. Please check the URL ({{error}})
status.serverError: Failed to connect to the server.

header.description: Connect a Git repository to visualize remote history.
header.label: Remote URL

empty.title: No Remote Configured
empty.description: A remote repository is required to experience push / pull / clone.
empty.duplicateName: A remote repository with the same name already exists.
empty.validation: Only alphanumeric characters, hyphens, and underscores allowed.
empty.deleteRemoteConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete remote {{name}} from the list?

terminal.instructions: To get started, please clone a repository using:
terminal.help: Type 'git help' to see available commands.

mission.notImplemented: Mission not yet implemented for this skill.
mission.terminalGuidance: Enter commands in the terminal below

confirmExit.title: Exit Mission?
confirmExit.message: Your progress will not be saved. Are you sure you want to exit?

learn.identifyConflict: Identify conflicting files with git status

init.name: git init
init.desc: Initialize a new repository. (Usually handled by "git clone" or system setup)

clone.name: git clone
clone.desc: Clone a repository. Try "git clone <url> <dir>" to specify a directory name.

status.name: git status
status.desc: Check which files are changed. Pro tip: Use "git status -sb" for a cleaner view.

help.name: git help
help.desc: Display help. Try "git help <command>" to see practical examples.

add.name: git add
add.desc: Stage changes. Use "git add ." for everything or "git add <file>" for precision.

commit.name: git commit
commit.desc: Save changes history. Pro tip: "git commit --amend" fixes the last commit.

push.name: git push
push.desc: Upload to remote. Note: GitGym simulates this safely.

pull.name: git pull
pull.desc: Fetch and merge. Try "git pull --rebase" to keep history linear.

branch.name: git branch
branch.desc: List/Create branches. Use "git branch -d" to delete merged branches.

switch.name: git switch
switch.desc: Switch branches. Use "git switch -c <name>" to create and switch instantly.

checkout.name: git checkout
checkout.desc: Switch branches or restore files using "git checkout -- <file>".

merge.name: git merge
merge.desc: Join branches. Use "git merge --no-ff" to preserve the merge history.

fetch.name: git fetch
fetch.desc: Download remote info. Use "git fetch --prune" to clean up deleted branches.

diff.name: git diff
diff.desc: Show changes. "git diff --staged" shows what you are about to commit.

log.name: git log
log.desc: Show history. Try "git log --oneline --graph" for a visual tree.

blame.name: git blame
blame.desc: Show who changed lines. Useful for debugging specific lines.

reset.name: git reset
reset.desc: Reset current HEAD to the specified state

rm.name: git rm
rm.desc: Remove files from the working tree

tag.name: git tag
tag.desc: Create, list, delete or verify tag object

stash.name: git stash
stash.desc: Stash the changes in a dirty working directory away

rebase.name: git rebase
rebase.desc: Reapply commits on top of another base tip

cherry_pick.name: git cherry-pick
cherry_pick.desc: Apply changes introduced by some existing commits
